text: his previous employer isn't likely to
have provided a glowing reference but
Edward Snowden has found himself a new
job this photograph published on a
Russian news website apparently shows
the whistleblower on a Moscow River
cruise now he'll have less time to watch
the world go by he's going to provide
technical support for one of Russia's
biggest websites his lawyer says he
can't reveal which one for security
reasons but he was able to clarify the
former US intelligence officer won't be
working for the Russian government his
new job is rumored to be with fee
contact the Russian equivalent of
Facebook its founder Pavel Durov
publicly offered Edward Snowden a job
using his own social networking page
back in August he suggested Edward
Snowden could help with protecting the
personal data of the site's millions of
users this is of course a man who knows
all about data protection
he's leaked thousands of documents
revealing the extent of us spying
activities they've sparked new tensions
between weary rivals caused rifts
between allies and fueled hundreds of
headlines on Thursday The Washington
Post
alleged that the National Security
Agency hacked links connecting data
centers operated by Google and Yahoo to
access vast amounts of private data the
revelations were met with outrage from
Google and denials from the NSA in this
video released last month showing mr.
Snowden at a meeting with other US
whistleblowers he appeared happy and
relaxed but he's said to be running out
of money as heads of state powerful
companies and internet uses the world
over real from the latest leaked
documents it's back to work for Edward
Snowden Emily Thomas BBC News
